poem:
Title: "Echoes of Grunge"

Two bands, once giants in a hallowed time,
A drowning sun, an empty glass of wine.
Smashing Pumpkins and Weezer in their prime,
Melding paths in one melodious line.
Mismatched, yet both hailed from the grunge birth,
Now aging, they render their once youth's mirth.
In ragged echoes, their music lingers,
Played once by stronger, more youthful fingers.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Smashing Pumpkins and Weezer review – mismatched 90s rockers bore and charm Co-headline tours of this ilk can allow relatively long-in-the-tooth artists to pool their fanbases and play large venues that they would not necessarily be able to fill on their own. Nevertheless, this particular pairing of two bands who arrived in the wake of the early 90s US grunge rock scene appears decidedly incongruous. When Weezer (★★★) emerged with a self-titled 1994 debut album". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Smashing Pumpkins and Weezer review – mismatched 90s rockers bore and charm Co-headline tours of this ilk can allow relatively long-in-the-tooth artists to pool their fanbases and play large venues that they would not necessarily be able to fill on their own. Nevertheless, this particular pairing of two bands who arrived in the wake of the early 90s US grunge rock scene appears decidedly incongruous.
